H0.text: Fungi are disease-causing types of organisms, such as Candida and Trichophyton, that become parasitic.

H1.text: Yeast are disease‑causing types of organisms, such as Candida and Trichophyton, that become parasitic.

H2.text: Bacteria are disease-causing types of organisms that become parasitic, exemplified by Candida and trichophyton.

H3.text: Viruses are the disease‑causing types of organisms that become parasitic, and Candida and Trichophyton are examples.

A4.text: Candida is a genus of yeasts.

A5.text: It is the most common cause of fungal infections worldwide and the largest genus of medically important yeasts.

A6.text: Trichophyton ... includes the parasitic varieties that cause tinea, including athlete's foot, ringworm, jock itch, and similar infections of the nail, beard, skin and scalp.

A7.text: The fungi can easily spread to other areas of the body as well and to the host's home environs (socks, shoes, clothes, showers, bathtubs, counters, floors, carpets, etc.).
